text: On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. This one has a deep dark brown colored body with a medium sized light beige dotting head. Smells like elder coffee with sugar and paper. Wood? Cocoa dryness. All in all it smells quite nice. Tastes really good also. Super lightdrinkable and theres a sweetish licorice tone in it. Not an extreme amount of coffee but whats there tastes quite good. Thin espresso from a machine. Mainly chocolate and chocolate milk here actually and who doesnt like that. 14.05.2016

On tap at BGH. Coffee and beans on the nose. Great strong aroma. Pours a brown black. Light bodied but with a strong malt and coffee flavor. Well balanced. Easy drinking. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big ass 32oz crowler, courtesy of Ibrew2or3 and hauled all the way to Belgium by Buckeyeboy, then off to Niger, Africa.
Brune foncée, col épais et tenace crémeux café au lait.
Arôme est plaisamment bien torréfié sans jamais tomber dans lexcès, ce dernier se retrouve pas mal au niveau de la mousse. La vanille est, quant à elle, plus discrète et subtile apportant une petite pointe de douceur en rétro-nasal. Rétro porte aussi qcq effluves de chocolaté, le houblon perce discrètement conférant des pointes de fraicheur.
Palais est malté, grillé superbement bien torréfié avec une base vanille qui apporte une bonne balance. Amertume portant un effet houblonné noble balance le tout et est accompagnée de notes herbacées.
Je note aussi un léger côté malt pils et cet effet métallique malt-grains pâle, cara. Effet de grains de café concassés.

Intensely perfumey sweet stout with lots of vanilla in the nose and subtle, never too hard coffee notes. Lasting light tan slice of foam. Round in mouth in spite of a watery feeling in mouth. Not particularly malty despite the roasted components. I could not pick up the oatmeal dose at all. Really geared toward the aromatic vanilla, even more so than the coffee which remains very well integrated and soft, gently smokey, just lightly roasty with no astringency at all and minimal acidity. I can see how this is a crowd pleasure, its a seductive flavour profile.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Black with tan head. Aromas of roast, dark chocolate, malt. Tastes of roasted coffee, dark chocolate, malt, light caramel. Medium body with a dry finish. Nice, easy drinking stout.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2017 Light coffee like old stains on your workdesk. Dark brown pour with decent head. Good mix but a little overrated - nowhere near as good as their brown ales. Some roast and a nudge of vanilla. Tap at Churchkey.

On tap at the brewery. Black appearance with a lacy tan head. Aroma of fresh coffee, bitter chocolate, roasted malt and a hint of vanilla. Similar flavor, rich, gourmet coffee flavor leading to a bittersweet finish over medium body. Quite nice, a little overly bitter, perhaps, but very good overall.

Keg at the Kings Arms, 14/11/16.
Black with a decent tan head.
Nose is mellow coffee grinds, roasted notes, toffee, charr, chocolate.
Taste carries a heavier coffee profile, chocolate biscuit, charr, roasted malt, coffee beans, toffee.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a roasted rasp.
Solid well balanced stout.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at the hanging bat. Pours black, nose is chocolate, caramel, roasted coffee, taste is sweet chocolate, bitter coffee.

Keg at the Kings Arms - London. Pours deep brown with a frothy, beige head. Nice aroma, moderate roast, some dry cocoa. Medium sweet flavour with well rounded baking cocoa character, a little scorched earth. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Well rounded bittersweet cocoa finish, with more roast, some raisins, a little scorched earth. Very drinkable stuff.

Intense coffee, dark roast filter, dark, toasted malts. Clear black, medium, creamy, beige head. Light bitter. More dark roast coffee, lightly sweetened, dark chocolate, soft carbonation, full bodied, lots of more coffee in the finish. Nice Stout, great coffee in aroma and palate. Keg at The Kings Arms, Bethnal Green.

Draught @ CBC 2016 [ Green Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, Oksnehallen Vesterbro, Halmtorvet 11, 1700 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Arizona Wilderness Superstition Coffee Stout ].Clear dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, coffee, dusty coffee. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, dusty coffee, dark malt, sweet malt - milk choolate, expresso. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20160514]
 7-4-7-4-15
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Black body with a small head. Coffee, roasted malt, milk chocolate, vanilla.
From tap. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, chocolate, careamel and bitterness.

A deep dark stout with a thin brown head. In aroma, beautiful bitter chocolate with coffee grind, resinous and smooth, musty character, light soy notes, nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice bitter sweet chocolate with coffee grind, light vanilla extract, musty character, alcohol warmth, very nice and interesting. On tap at brewery.

Crowler, pours black with a large foamy white head. Aroma is heavy on the coffee, with loads of espresso and a touch of roast. Flavour is dominated by the coffee, with a lovely espresso notes dominating. A lovely coffee bomb, with a smooth, creamy palate. Excellent.

32 oz crowler pour at Eugenes farewell tasting. Thanks to Matt for the share. Near black pour with a patchy tan head. Premium roast espresso aroma. Incredible. Creamy flavor with a modest bitter coffee presence. Soft vanilla throughout, but a bit covered by a mocha constant. Easy drinker, and very pleasant. Awesome.
Draft - pours dark brown tan head - nose/taste of vanilla, cinnamon sticks, coffee and chocolate - medium body

CBC. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little vegetable and little espresso. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little espresso, little vegetable, medium sweet, little liquorice and medium bitter.
Draft. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma has rich coffee and caramel notes. Nice toffee kick. Sweet and moderately roasty. Nice stout. Thicker mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

32 oz growler, received in a trade with PDXAmbassador. Canned on April 28, 16. Full thick head that coats the snifter until the very last drop. Aroma is cocoa nibs, rich coffee and very mild hints of vanilla beans. 
The flavor is real rich but balanced by a nice deep roasted malt backbone. Chocolate and roast upfront with coffee lingering after the sip. Vanilla is also notable and this stout never becomes overly sweet. Mild bitter chocolate. At the gravity level this has a ton of flavor! Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy and gives a velvet texture. This is 100% legit. I drank the entire Crowler myself, easy to do. And I felt no remorse about it.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Beer Celebration 2016, Copenhagen - black pour with a beige head. Sweet roasted malty aroma and taste with prominent coffee, chocolate, caramel, vanilla essence into the finish.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Green session, København
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and caramel. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long coffee and chocolate finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 - Green session. Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, caramel. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium to full silky almost creamy body with soft carbonation.

Crowler at the bottle share. Dark dark brown pour with a modest ring of beige head. Huge coffee and roast aroma, a little hint of mocha. Tastes like a coffee stout should, big bold espresso flavors blended with the roasted malt. Lights bits of chocolate. Well done.
Crowler dark brown black lots of soft roast and coffee aromas and flavors. Smooth palate and very drinkable

Crowler pours out dark brown almost black topped with a small head tan head. Nose is nice big coffee some milk chocolate roast malts. Taste is more of the roast malts nice coffee rich chocolate sweetness.

Draught @ CBC. Pours very dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla. Flavor is light sweet, bitter, malty, coffee, caramel, chocolate, vanilla. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. 140516
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Pours black with a creamy head. Slick and vinous. Good coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Beany. Very tasty!

Crowler. Thx Tommy.
Pours black with high beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of coffee, vanilla, roasted malt, chocolate. Taste is of coffee, vanilla, slightly spicy, chocolate. Palate: Full bodied. Light carbonation. Overall: OK, normal stuff.
Sample at CBC 2016. Dark malty smell with coffee. Similar taste, roasted and toasted. Coffee dominates.

Draught on CBC 2016, Green session. Filmy beige layer leaving dotted spots on the glass. Dark brown coloured body. Strong coffee nose, nicely roasted. Coffee up front to the taste buds, nuts and wood beneath. Ends with bitterness from the coffee grounds. Medium bodied. decent coffee stout (Øksnehallen, Copenhagen 14.05.2016).
CBC. Black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 140516
Sampled at CBC 2016 - second day. Rich coffee notes, together with roasted malts, a bit of molasses and vanilla. Good stuff.

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Black with a tan head. Aroma is coffee, vanilla, chocolate, dark fruits. Full bodied, roasty on the palate. Taste is coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate. A little one note.
Draft. A brown beer with a tan head. The aroma has notes of coffee, roasted malt, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of coffee, roasted malt, and alcohol, leading to a dry roasted finish.

@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, GREENbrowny hazy. Bit doughy, brown malty bready nose. Cold coffee, malty. Med bodied, soft round, some sweetness. Strange. Kinda brown aley ipa mix.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Crowler (1 L) shared at tasting. Thanks a ton to kbudd19 for this one! About 5 weeks old. Dark reddish-brown with a small beige head leaving little lacing. Aroma is mostly of vanilla but also coffee, sweet-ish notes, chocolate, nutty notes and mild fruitiness. Taste is more on the sweet stout level though not cloying, vanilla forward, coffee, chocolate, mild berries, burnt caramel and mild bitterness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. A bit oily. Vanilla finish with nice coffee. Not so easy drinking because its on the sweet-ish side and vanilla forward but really flavorful. Good.

Pours a very dark brown with a medium beige head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of coffee, mokah. Light powdered cacao. Taste is of vanilla, coffee and is moderately bitter. Not too sweet. No ash. Body is medium, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel is a bit weak but Im not even sure I should mention it since it is still quite drinkable and good. A fairly nice tasty stout!
CBC2016. Trübes dunkel orange braunes Bier mit einer geringen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Kaffee, Vanille. Geschmack röstmalzig bitter, Karamell, Vanille, Sahne.

14.05.2016, tap @ CBC:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is rich, espresso, dark malts, dark sugar, caramel, vanilla, chocolate, toffee, grass, nuts, roasted grain. Taste is slightly dry, espresso, minerals, weeds, roasted grain, toast, grass, burnt caramel, nuts, weeds, dark malts, bark. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry roasted mouthfeel. Nice.

crowler shared by tom10101, thanks dude! pours hazy brown with a very nice beige head, creamy lacing. nutty chocolate, milky treacle, roasted fruitiness, clean yeast. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily; smooth and sweetish woodsy finish. very solid (sweet) coffee stout.

Canette datée du 31/03/2016, bue après 5 semaines. Robe brune très foncée aux minces reflets noisette sans col de mousse. Arômes de malt rôti, grains de café grillées, expresso, chocolat au lait, vanille. Petit côté minéral et houblonné. En bouche, beaucoup de vanille, un malt rôti épais et chocolaté. Finale qui dévoile des grains expresso avec toujours cette enveloppe de vanille. Texture épaisse et corps rond. Très bon stout.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2016 i can see why this is 99th percentile. at first glance/whiff/sip, its a good coffee stout - not anything different than others, just done better. As it warms, the complexity from the coffee used just takes off...nutty, bitter chocolate, light fruitiness. Really complex. Body is light for a stout, with low-medium carbonation (5 d.o. growler) but is super smooth. Nice coffee bittersweet nutty finish. Similar to Vanilla Joe from Sante. Maybe not as smooth as that one, but more complex.
[1/31/16] Draught sample at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Black. Big coffee beans, roast. Quite dry, bitter.
Draft at the source. Nearly opaque dark brown color, tan head. Aroma has coffee, chocolate, vanilla. Taste is coffee forward but still beery, with cocoa and vanilla beans. Very tasty.
Taster. Black with tan head and lacing. Dark roasted coffee and dark chocolate... Complex flavors but very coffee forward...
At the source. Good coffee dry roasted. Much vanila as it warms. Bang on coffee stout.

Tap at Magic Rocks Rainbow Project launch. Dark brown/black shade. Little to no head atop. Really bold coffee notes in the aroma. Taste is chocolate brownie, loads of coffee and faint red fruits lurking beneath. Not enough going on besides the coffee for me to fully enjoy it, but its well made.

Keg - Beavertown - thanks Logan for importing it and thanks to the brewers for turning up and chilling out with me at Beavertown. Sorry you couldnt get to Zwanze Day. 

Huge notes of espresso coffee. I dont know how many beans they used for this but its a huge amount. I just got pure coffee beans in a stout. This puts other coffee stouts to shame. The complexity and depth of the bean with the stout works. Its super smooth and velvety on the finish. Loads of Belgian chocolate and really good malt usage. 

Please bottle some up and send to England. I was so impressed.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2016 Keg at the Magic Rock rainbow ?? event... Dark black.. Thin tan lacing.. Soft chocolate roast. Dark malts.. Dark malts.. Dark roast... Sweet chocolate roast.. Dark malts.. Light roast.. Dark chocolate.. Dark chocolate roast Keg at hanging bat... Dark black.. Thin tan lacing.. Rich chocolate coffee nose.. Dark rich coffee roast... 3.8
draft. Black with an off white head. Aroma is vanilla, roast, malts, espresso. Body is medium, finish is roasty with a touch of vanilla sweetness. Really well done stout.

Draft. Pours a deep stout brown with a tan head. Nose is a burst of coffee, some chocolate, some vanilla, and mild earth. Flavor is similar with roast, earth, vanilla, and coffee. Medium in body and very nice stout.
Growler. Pours a dark brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong roast, coffee beam, dark chocolate. Thin mouth, similar flavors to nose, bitter finish, good.
This is a serious coffee stout, with a ton of coffee bitterness, stout smoothness, roasted malts. Aroma is the same as the flavor. At the brewery.

On nitro at the brewery. Pours a dark brown black with a cream colored head. Aromas of light coffee and chocolate. Taste is quite minimal. Smooth texture and very easy drinking. Not over the top but could probably use a tad more coffee.

One of my favorite coffee beers in all the land. Ebony-hued with ruby highlights and a dense, creamy head the color of donut guts. The aroma leads with nutty, oily coffee beans, backed up by soft tones of vanilla, graham cracker and oatmeal. The beans are sharper and more burnt in the flavor, but are softened by the increased presence of vanilla bean and peanuts.

Nitro on location. Most wonderful smell of any coffee stout I have had. A little less malt or hop than I was expecting from a stout. Nitro makes it smooth, if a little watery. Great mouth watery aftertaste.

Extremely balanced and very approachable. Love ABV but this one is pretty damn complex given the ABV. Only 5.7% but the alcohol content is not at all indicative of the flavor or aroma. Assertive with the stats available. Solid but not world class.

A very nice coffee stout. What makes this one is the flavor vis-a-vis the ABV. Great stout base -- just a "wee" hint of sweetness and roastiness. Coffee flavor is subdued, and not over the top. Quite quaffable.

Tap at the source. Black pour with a very small creamy head that fades to a nice thick ring. Aroma is all fresh coffee beans with just a light roast. Lovely. Tastes solid too. Mostly fresh coffee beans, light creamy sweetness, light roast, and light pine even. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Great stout.
draft, i liked this one! Good roasty tasty stout base. Nice coffee flavors, great coffee aroma and finish. Very well made all around. Nice!

Draft at the brewery. Pours almost black with a fizzy off white head. Tastes like rich dark coffee, dark chocolate, sweet vanilla, dry booze. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like rich coffee, dark chocolate, booze, and faint vanilla.

Draft at brewery. Pours deep, dark brown with fizzy beige head. Aroma is roasted and chocolate malts, vanilla, faint oats, and light coffee notes. Flavor is chocolate, roast, ash, earthy notes, and some coffee notes; came across as a little thin which was further accentuated by the carbonation level. Light/medium body and medium carbonation.

(Bue en fût sur place); Lespresso est immense dans ce stout et vole la vedette aux quelconques prétendants à la course aux saveurs. Probablement la plus intense présence torréfiée possible pour cette grosseur de stout.
Jet black and oily. Big delicious coffee aroma. Taste is like a delicious creamy cold Brew. Excellent light roast coffee with dark roast malt. Fantastic.

On tap @ Arizona Wilderness. Black in color with a tan head. Super heavy on the coffee. Nice roasted nuts and earthy coffee. Plenty of roasted malt and hazelnut. Some vanilla and dark chocolate. Nice stuff. The flavor is similarly dominated by the coffee. Plenty of roast, coffee grounds, vanilla, and hazelnut. Notes of cocoa and dark fruit/black cherry. A hint of sweetness and a nice bitterness.

Pretty much smells and tastes very similar to a nice cup of coffee. If someone gave me this and didnt tell me what it was, I might actually think it was coffee. Medium body with very very light carbonation.

Growler courtesy of BOLTZ7555, thanks J! Pours a dark black, somewhat transparent with brown hues. Aromas of coffee galore. A nice, dark roast. Some char and then vanilla sweetness. Taste is very nicely balanced with a dark roast coffee upfront and the typical bitterness subdued by the vanilla bean. Medium-light body, with fairly lively carbonation. Good stout!

Good full stout. Roasted and sweet aromas. Nice cascading dark color with a good foamy head. Weighty palate with a creamy smoothness. Roasted coffee and vanilla with a touch of lactose-like sweetness.

Growler, thanks to agent zigzag! Pours deep clear ruby black with a small tan head and some lacing. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, mocha, deep roasted malts. Flavor is rich mocha, light sweet and light bitter, touch of vanilla for good measure. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation. A darn good beer that I bet is even better fresh off the tap.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2015 Draft. Black. Fair, lasting, creamy light brown head. Phenomenal coffee character all around. Fresh ground coffee. Vanilla compliments. Chocolate balanced a smooth roastiness. Very mild bitterness. Sweetness to balance. Medium body. Smooth and oh so drinkable. Outstanding coffee beer. ** New recipe (which replaces 2 lbs of the superstition blend with espresso) rocks. I like it even more.

Taste on tap. Lots of different sized bubbles off the nitro tap, its black and opaque. It doesnt taste 6.6%. It actually sort of tastes just like coffee off the nitro, you have to adjust your expectations a bit. Enjoy the difference, its good man. They used decent coffee, i think. Yeah its an intense taste, with rich, pleasant bitterness. Good cuppa joe!

Draft taster at the brewpub. Same appearance as its base beer, the Organ Pipe, which is to say that this is a very attractive stout. Deep coffee brown with a finger of khaki-colored head. Gorgeous. Big coffee aroma, with dark chocolate, burnt toast, and leaves - really coffee-forward. The flavor showcases more of the vanilla than the nose does. Light-medium bodied, with low to moderate carbonation and a rich, smooth mouthfeel. I like what the coffee and vanilla did to the base beer. Really tasty.
Draft - Coffee and vanilla, like the chocolate covered coffee beans. Jet black with a rich nitro beige head. Much more subdued than I expected. Still full of dark roast.

Tap at brewery. I had just had an espresso from superstition only to find myself a few minutes later enjoying this beer made with it. This is great coffee and it really comes through in beer. Pours deep brown and nose is espresso, vanilla, and malt. Tastes much of the same in all best ways. Its bitter and creamy and goes down so smooth. My kind of stout

Nitro on tap at brewpub. Black pour with medium sized beige head. Aroma is pure coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Taste is big time coffee with initial taste of green vanilla beans, roasted malts, bittersweet chocolate and faint caramel notes. Full bodied, soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel with slightly bitter finish. Excellent beer!
Big time coffee here - I mean big time! This one was nitro for me at the brewpub. Smells like a morning cup o joe and tastes phenomenal

The beer is a concentrated brown, almost black color that is clear, and a deep, dark brown hue when held up directly to the light. The head is a nicely brown tinged, dark tan colored head. There is a really a huge coffee aromatic note, almost floral, blackened caramel, concentrated dark chocolate notes, rich deeply toasted nutty notes, supporting vanilla notes, and really just a huge, complex coffee character to the nose.

Quite dry, very bitter, burnt, roasted, almost coke like roasted character, but up front lots of dark chocolate notes, lots of roasted nutty notes, and a touch of roasted, dark caramel notes. The body is fairly light, and could perhaps use a touch more richness as a beer, as it rests on the palate a bit too much like a cup of cold coffee; it is a bit on the thin side, for a beer that is well balanced by the expressive coffee notes. 

Deep, rich, coffee notes, floral roasted aromatics, burnt caramel, rich vanilla, and really just a complex coffee character are so noticeable and balanced in this beer. This is definitely a beer for coffee lovers, if you do, it is incredibly complex and charcterful, but if you dont, then it could be overwhelming and one-dimensional.

32oz growler pours with a nice dark looking mahogany colored body that supports a light mocha colored head of foam. The aroma is straight up big fresh kind of dusty dark roasted coffee grounds and a light degree of chocolate and earthiness at the end of the draw. This taste has the same dark roasted coffee goodness where it almost seems like a grain or two of coffee grounds are rolling around my palate. Behind the big coffee notes are some mild chocolate and vanilla that help even out all the roastiness. All of those notes ride into the finish where theyre greeted by a sliver of a mineral sort of note. Nice.

Thanks to GT2 for sharing! Pour is dark black with large tan head. Rich coffee aroma with warm vanilla. Taste is tons of coffee, some cinnamon, a hint of vanilla. Its got a lot of coffee without being too acidic, but if you dont like the taste of coffee, you wont like this beer. I like coffee, so I think its great. The palate is a bit thin and could use maybe a bit more sugar or richness to balance it out, but otherwise this is a good offering overall.

32oz growler thanks to Ibrew2or3. Clear, lighter brown pour, thick light tan head with incredible formation and retention. Rocky, sheen hop content driven head. Great, complete lacing everywhere. Nose is more in the decadent vanilla and robust espresso vain, dry Kenyan/Ethiopian powerful roast. Taste isnt too acidic, though it is still coffee and roasted malt derived acidic/tart but it isnt lemony, with a thinner than expected body. Still, it is not watery and is very bitter from both the powerful roast and hefty hop content. Overall, as a non coffee drinker and a skeptic for all coffee beers, I enjoyed this a lot and so did my much more picky stout and coffee loving wife, biggirlpanties. If I had to pick one descriptor, it really tastes a lot like a high quality mega espresso.

Its basically just a cup of coffee. Im considering filling a mug tomorrow before work! Huge roasty flavor, lots of ground coffee flavor. Have you ever had chocolate covered espresso beans? This is a liquid form of that. I can actually imagine the little crunch and bits of coffee between nay teeth while I drink it. This is fantastic.

32 oz. growlette from Daknole. Thanks! It pours black with a nice creamy tan head. The aroma is huge with fresh ground coffee, dark chocolate, hints of vanilla sweetness and herbal hops. The flavor is the same. Massive coffee flavors without any acidity or astringency. Dark chocolate and a little herbal hop bitterness in the finish. Amazing stuff and very drinkable. Maybe my favorite coffee beer to date!

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2014 Tried the latest batch. They finally nailed it imo. Perfect amount of coffee aroma, and the coffee taste was in perfect balance to the rest of the beer. On nitro so it had that glorious creamy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2014 On nitro at the brewery (batch 3). Dark brown in appearance with a khaki-colored, craggy two-fingered head. Clean, fresh-roasted coffee beans dominate the aroma; roasted malts, bitter, earthy spices, some cacao nibs, and traces of vanilla also add to the nose. Extremely roast-forward flavor, from both the coffee and malts, that transitions to a clean coffee taste with a bold yet pleasant vanilla sweetness. Medium body with a great creamy texture and slight lingering roasty bitter finish. This batch on nitro is an improvement over the first batches on CO2; the creaminess and vanilla flavor kicks in up a notch.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2013 At the brewery, black pour, tan head. Aroma is very coffee forward with some vanilla in the mix. Taste has espresso, vanilla and a little bitter dark chocolate in the finish. Update: After a day, the finish has mellowed a little bit. Even smoother and better now.  Excellent!

Coffee heaven! Pours a mostly clear dark brown color. Aroma? Coffee! And more coffee! Fresh brewed coffee, hints of vanilla, roasted malt, a slight bitter finish. If you dont like coffee this isnt for you.
